fact_check_explanation_title: Nobody knows how many lives could be saved by a seven-day NHS
fact_check_explanation_summary: It's claimed that better NHS care at weekends—the "7-day NHS"—could save 3,000 lives, or 6,000, or somewhere in between. In reality, nobody really knows.

fact_check_explanation_title: The human rights victories won by criminals
fact_check_explanation_summary: Just under half the cases won against the UK at the European Court of Human Rights have involved someone convicted or suspected of a criminal offence.

fact_check_explanation_title: The UK can't be forced to accept more refugees
fact_check_explanation_summary: The EU can't force Britain to take a "quota" of refugees from other EU countries. The UK can choose to opt in to any such EU plan.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ask Full Fact: Germany hasn't accepted 800,000 Syrian refugees
fact_check_explanation_summary: Germany will end up accepting hundreds of thousands of refugees, both from Syria and the wider world, but 800,000 Syrians accepted to date is way off.

fact_check_explanation_title: Do asset sales save the government money?
fact_check_explanation_summary: George Osborne found £4.5 billion in savings to be made by the government, including asset sales. Do asset sales count as savings?

fact_check_explanation_title: International law and the death of Reyaad Khan
fact_check_explanation_summary: The death of a British citizen, Reyaad Khan, in an RAF drone strike has led to debate about whether or not the killing was allowed under international law.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is the performance of disadvantaged pupils improving?
fact_check_explanation_summary: School performance of disadvantaged pupils has, for the most part, been improving. The trend is less clear for the gap between these pupils and their peers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are graduates settling for non-graduate jobs?
fact_check_explanation_summary: CIPD says 58.8% of graduates are in non-graduate roles, but this is based on an old survey.
Investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) is at the heart of the debate over a proposed treaty, TTIP, between the EU and US. Here's who wins ISDS cases.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ask Full Fact: does the NHS spend £30 million pulling kids' teeth because of sugar?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jamie Oliver's "Sugar Rush" campaign has claimed that extracting kids' teeth due to sugar is costing £30 million a year. It's not quite that simple.

fact_check_explanation_title: Has the UK only taken in 216 Syrian refugees?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A number of outlets are claiming that the UK has taken in so few Syrian refugees that you could fit them all on a tube train. This is wrong.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many free schools are in deprived communities?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Based on the available data, just under 45% of open mainstream free schools are in areas ranked as in the 30% most deprived.
